context_of_use: This use case allows Regular Users to view and download report files for offline access and analysis.
stakeholders_and_interests: Regular User: wants to access reports for personal use and analysis.
description: Allows Regular Users to view and download report files for offline access and analysis.
triggering_event: Regular User requests to view and download a report.
preconditions: Regular User has access to reports
postconditions: Regular User can access the report offline
assumptions: Regular Users have the necessary permissions to download reports.
requirements_met: The system shall allow Regular Users to view and download reports for offline access.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of reports available for download.
main_flow: 1. Regular User requests to view a report → System verifies user permissions.
2. System retrieves the requested report → System prepares the report for viewing.
3. Regular User decides to download the report → System initiates the download of the report file.
4. User receives the report file → Report file is available for offline access.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the Regular User does not have permission, then System displays an error message and denies the download.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the report is not available, then System displays an error message indicating the report is unavailable.
